bibl.title: George Daly v. J.H. McGraw. Petition for Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in the county of King Wash. Terr.
In the matter of the application of George R. Daly, for a writ of Habeas Corpus
div1.p: Now comes George r. Daly the above named petitioner, by McNaught, Ferry, McNaught + Mitchell up the his Corpus person his attorney and to the sufficency of the return made by J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of King COunty, Wash. Terr.to the writ of Habwas Corpus herein this day, say that the facts set forth in the said return are not sufficent lawful authority to justify the imprisionment and detention of the petitioner by the said J.H. McGraw for the grounds and reasons following to wit:

That the alleged was arrested of extradition, set forth in the said refund return and which purports to have been issued
by the his excellency, William A. Newell, Govenor of Washington Territory - does not: -
First; State any positively any specific crime to have been committed by the said George R. Daly, nor set forth the specific crime with which he was charged nor charges any crime.

Second. Nor does it recite or set forth the indictment or affidavit upon which it is founded; nor does it state that any suff affidavit or indictment was submitted to the said Govenor of Washington Territory to authorize him to issue the said warrant.
Third. Nor does the said warrant show upon its face that it was duly issued according to law.
div1.ab: McNaught Ferry McNaught + Mitchell Attorneys for Petitioner
